clinical_study.brief_title: Confocal Laserscanning Microscopy for Detection of Barretts Esophagus
clinical_study.official_title: Confocal Laserscanning Microscopy for Detection of Barretts Esophagus. A Blinded Multi-Center Study.

brief_summary.textblock: Four quadrant biopsies in regular ranges is the goldstandard in monitoring this disease. The ideal situation for the endoscopist is to visualize cellular structures, which implies having microscopic imaging available. A potential candidate to fill this gap could be confocal fluorescence microscopy (Cellvizio®-GI and Mauna Kea Technologies). To compare the gold standard with the confocal fluorescence microscopy for detection of metaplastic - or intraepithelial neoplastic changes of barrett-suspicious esophageal mucosa this study has been initiated.

primary_outcome.measure: diagnostic accuracy of confocal laser scanning microscopy for detection of metaplasia or neoplasia in Barrett´s esophagus

secondary_outcome.measure: inter- and intra observer variability for confocal laser scanning microscopy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age between 18 and 80 years
- regular esophagogastroduodenoscopy for patients with known barrett esophagus (at least stadium C0M1)
- patients presenting for endoscopic mucosectomy with intraepithelial neoplastic changes <1cm
- patients presenting with suspected intraepithelial neoplastic changes
- patients receiving acid suppressive therapy in standard dose for at least 4 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- no informed consent
- thrombocytopenia, quick <50%, PTT >50 sec
- patients with coronary heart disease or existent valve plasties
- women with potential pregnancy
- patients with chronic renal failure
- patients with allergies
- patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
